senses.de: Grow or cause something to grow and become more mature, advanced, or elaborate
senses.ex: His interest in photography began to develop when his uncle gave him a camera.

Tips.title: Abstract Concepts
Tips.description: Used when referring to ideas or qualities rather than physical objects.
Tips.example: She helped to develop the theory behind the technology.

Tips.title: Personal Growth
Tips.description: Can describe the process of improving skills or character.
Tips.example: He plans to develop his leadership skills through volunteer work.

Tips.title: Emotional Nuance
Tips.description: Sometimes implies a slow and natural progression.
Tips.example: Their friendship took years to develop.

senses.de: Start to become larger or stronger, or to grow in important ways
senses.ex: The fetus starts to develop its body organs in the eighth week.

Tips.title: Medical State
Tips.description: Used for the growth of biological or medical conditions.
Tips.example: Healthy habits can reduce the chance to develop heart disease.

Tips.title: Neutral Tone
Tips.description: In medical context, it does not suggest if the outcome is good or bad.
Tips.example: It is common for patients to develop a fever after surgery.

senses.de: Make something new, such as a product or a mental or artistic creation
senses.ex: His team is developing a new app for language learners.

Tips.title: Innovation
Tips.description: Implies creating something original or improving existing things.
Tips.example: The engineer hopes to develop a more efficient battery.

Tips.title: Product Evolution
Tips.description: Suggests the refining or enhancement of a product over time.
Tips.example: The company plans to further develop its software next year.

senses.de: Treat photographic film with chemicals to make a picture appear
senses.ex: He learnt how to shoot and develop his own film.

Tips.title: Specific Skillset
Tips.description: Requires knowledge of a specialized process or technique.
Tips.example: Photographers must learn how to correctly develop film in a darkroom.

Tips.title: Technical Jargon
Tips.description: Used as jargon in photography, unfamiliar outside the field.
Tips.example: I prefer to develop my photos rather than using digital prints.

senses.de: Describes how something changes over time and progresses
senses.ex: The plot develops slowly in the first few chapters.

Tips.title: Story Evolution
Tips.description: Used in writing to describe how plot or characters change.
Tips.example: A good novel will develop complex characters that evolve.

Tips.title: Subtle Changes
Tips.description: Often involves gradual, nuanced change, not always obvious.
Tips.example: Throughout the film, you can see the protagonist's motives develop.

Advance.wordDefinition:
Advance refers to moving forward or progressing, often in a specific field or area.

It can be applicable in terms of gaining more knowledge or improving skills in a certain subject or task. For example, a student may advance their mathematics skills by taking more advanced courses.

Advance refers to progress in a more personal sense, while develop refers to progress in a more tangible, external sense.

Enhance.wordDefinition:
Enhance means to improve or make something better, but the thing already exists. For example, a photographer may enhance a photo to make it look better or a speaker may enhance their presentation by adding visual aids.

Develop refers to creating something new, while enhance refers to improving an existing thing. They can be used in different contexts depending on what you want to achieve.

Evolve.wordDefinition:
Evolve refers to the gradual and natural changes in something over time.

If you are talking about something changing naturally or gradually on its own, then you are talking about it 'evolving'.

Expand.wordDefinition: Expand means to increase in size, volume or scope. It is applicable when talking about a business, a market, or a physical space.

Flourish.wordDefinition:
Flourish refers to something that is already doing well or thriving. It implies success, prosperity and abundance. For example, a business might be said to be flourishing if it is making a lot of money and growing rapidly.

To put it simply, develop refers to the process of improvement and growth, while flourish refers to something that is already thriving and successful.

Grow.wordDefinition:
Grow refers to an increase in size, quantity or capability, with no specific outcome or purpose. For instance, plants grow naturally, people grow physically.

So, in simple terms, develop is used when someone wants to achieve a specific goal or outcome, while grow is used when something increases in size, quantity, or capability without any specific outcome or purpose.

Improve.wordDefinition:
Develop means to create or build something new or from scratch, while improve means to enhance or make something better than it already is.

For example, if you are building a new product or concept, you would use the word 'develop.' If you're trying to make an existing product or concept better or more efficient, you would use 'improve.'

Develop is more applicable when starting from scratch or creating something entirely new, while improve is more applicable when you want to make something that already exists better in some way.

Mature.wordDefinition:
Mature refers to the state or quality of being full-grown or fully developed. When something reaches maturity, it has reached its full potential, like a ripe fruit or an adult person.

To sum it up, develop refers to the process of growth and progress, while mature refers to the state of being fully grown or developed.

Develop can be applicable to many different areas, including skills, ideas, and technology, whereas mature most often applies to a person's emotional or mental growth.

quotes.Text: Since the team understands that the leader is de facto in charge, in that respect, a leader has nothing to prove. But in another respect, a leader has everything to prove: Every member of the team must develop the trust and confidence that their leader will exercise good judgment, remain calm, and make the right decisions when it matters most.
quotes.Title: American
quotes.Name: Jocko Willink

quotes.Text: I believe that God has put gifts and talents and ability on the inside of every one of us. When you develop that and you believe in yourself and you believe that you're a person of influence and a person of purpose, I believe you can rise up out of any situation.
quotes.Title: American Clergyman
quotes.Name: Joel Osteen

quotes.Text: I know that one of the great arts that the writer develops is the art of saying, 'No. No, I'm finished. Bye.' And leaving it alone. I will not write it into the ground. I will not write the life out of it. I won't do that.
quotes.Title: American Poet
quotes.Name: Maya Angelou

quotes.Text: In Britain, like most of the developed world, stem-cell research is regarded as a great opportunity. America will be left behind if it doesn't change policy.
quotes.Title: English Physicist
quotes.Name: Stephen Hawking

quotes.Text: God, our Creator, has stored within our minds and personalities, great potential strength and ability. Prayer helps us tap and develop these powers.
quotes.Title: Indian Statesman
quotes.Name: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

quotes.Text: Especially when you have a lot of technology you're developing as a small company, trying to protect that technology is a real problem.
quotes.Title: American Inventor
quotes.Name: Lonnie Johnson

quotes.Text: In acting, you have to pull from real-life situations, from people, to help develop a character.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Kevin Hart

quotes.Text: You've got to learn to survive a defeat. That's when you develop character.
quotes.Title: American President
quotes.Name: Richard M. Nixon

quotes.Text: Character, like a photograph, develops in darkness.
quotes.Title: Canadian Photographer
quotes.Name: Yousuf Karsh

quotes.Text: Character develops itself in the stream of life.
quotes.Title: German Writer
quotes.Name: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
